physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient presented with weight loss, anorexia, diarrhea, diffuse abdominal pain, and iron deficiency anemia. A subsequent evaluation revealed elevated serum antigliadin Ig level and the presence of antiendomyseal antibodies.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Symptoms progressed over time; patient complained of abdominal pain and muscle aches despite adherence to a gluten-free diet.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Postoperative findings included a normal-appearing left inferior parathyroid gland, but the serum calcium concentration initially decreased after surgery.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: One week post-operation, serum calcium increased to 2.68 mmol/liter, indicating lack of persistent improvement.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Continued symptomatology with anxiety, depression, generalized aches, and sensations of deep bony pain. Serum calcium levels remained elevated.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Serum calcium levels exhibited fluctuation but remained elevated, with no significant improvement in symptoms.
